newsitem.title: USA: CallWare integrates with Microsoft, Lotus.
newsitem.headline: CallWare integrates with Microsoft, Lotus.

text.p: CallWare Technologies Inc said Tuesday it has integrated with Microsoft Corp's Microsoft Exchange and Outlook and with International Business Machines Corp's Lotus Notes e-mail to provide unified messaging for mobile and office-based users.

The company said the integration allows users to view, control, save and forward CallWare voice mail messages from their inboxes and give them access to their e-mail, faxes and voice mail in the same location.
CallWare, a private company, also said it made two OEM agreements, one with Xerox Corp and the other with Lucent Technologies Inc.
The company said its Xerox OEM, or original equipment manufacturing, pact allows it to integrate TextBridge scanning software with CallWare's IntrFAX fax server.

The coupling of these technologies will allow people to edit incoming faxes without manually scanning a hard copy of the document. They will be able to send incoming faxes directly to a printer and retain complete document integrity.
TextBridge will be included in every IntrFAX software package, the company said.
With Lucent, CallWare will integrate its Phonetastic software with Lucent's new Merlin Legend X5 communications system.
The package will be sold through Lucent's direct distribution and authorized dealer channels, the company said.
No terms for the OEM agreements were available.
